reviewText:
Early Access Review

I recommend this game because its fun to run around, dig, build, create.  One can experiment with architectural design.  That's enough for me to be satisfied but the game as a story has major problems:

Be prepared to be frustrated with bugs in the story line.  I've played this game on and off for a while, seen it go through quite a few versions.  On an earlier version I was able to play through story mode pretty far, as far as the developers had written.  My saves were erased with an upgrade and given the amount of time I had spent crafting a delightful and luxurious base, I became discouraged.  I tried to restart, to plod through the storyline with its many fetch-type quests but with another upgrade those saves got erased too.  Recently I came back to the game and have been having fun with it again.  Strangely, though, I cannot get very far in the story quests.  They are extremely buggy.  The story quests appear to have actually become quite a bit MORE buggy since the last time I'd played it.  I can't get past the first quest (a critical character has irretrievably disappeared, and was just reading about the second quest having a high likelihood of a massive game ending type bug also.

It is difficult to program games and I respect the hard work.  That being said, I recommend the developers focus on making the core gameplay stable instead of pursuing shiny, new, additional features with each update. I fear/suspect the game has been dropped as a serious development project and that core bugs will not be fixed.  It appears to be used as a template for experimentation instead.  That's cool but It would be nice to be able to actually play it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I honestly want to recommend this game, but I just can't.

Environments become a bit bland after a few minutes, and often fail to load.
If you even think about using a jetpack or hang glider for any distance you're doomed, as every time I used them I ended up clipping through the ground and getting trapped below the world.
Animations are awkward and combat is just boring.

Now I will admit that the crafting system is fun, being able to dig tunnels and build bases, but the building system is so complecated that by the time you've mastered it you will probably be out of creative energy and just want to play something else.

Basically, if they would clean up the animations, simplify the menu's and building system, and put some serious time into fixing their landscapes, this could be a really fun game, but it is seriously shackled by these shortcomings.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't know about the other reviews, the game is being very actively developed, just check the log.  There is a new beta release about monthly.   It's also Early access, bugs are to be expected and then you give feedback.  I see so many early access reviews complaining about bugs.

Pretty awesome game and it's still in early access.  I also got Grav around the same time and both games are fun but each is different in big ways.  I had debated on which one to get for a while but in the end I got both thanks to my brother and his generosity.

Both game are beautiful with  bright and varied environments.  This will not be a review of Grav, I'll just briefly touch on some of the main differences.

Planet Explorers Story mode is the single player mode.  It has NPCs, missions and a story line.  I've only been playing Grav solo because the free weekend seems to have brought some griefers into the multiplayer servers and I wasn't about to deal with that, so I can't speak too much to the public multiplay, though I did set up a server for a friend and me to play.  Grav's single player is more just about exploration, but there are some tasks that you get some rewards for.

The story in Planet Explorers is pretty in depth so far.  You'll meet a lot of NPCs, with a lot of missions and rewards.  The biggest difference is with the crafting systems.  Planet Explorers is insanely cool when it comes to this.  In Grav you're working with about 10 resources that you'll need to craft pre-designed items, such as a jetpack or monocycle.  You'll have different workbenches for creating different items.  Planet Explorers has a lot more resources for creating things.  And then you'll create a few things to create bigger things, and then there is a custom editor built into the game for designing weapons, cars, planes, etc...There is no pre-made car, you have to build the wheels, cockpit, engine, fuel cell and then build it and export it into your world.  For example when I had to build a car for a mission, I needed wood and rubber for the wheels, steel, iron and motherboard for the enginer, and to make that motherboard I needed plastic and copper wiring.  This may sound tedious, but it isn't because you can click on a component in the crafting window and it will then open that component so you can click on the ingredients and make them and traverse the heirarchy that way.  It's VERY easy to quickly make components and see which components will create which parts.  You then go into the ISO editor (the name for a custom creation is ISO), which is like a modeler if you're familiar with 3D Modeling.  You'll place the 4 wheels, cockpit, engine, fuelcell and then build your car however you want.  If you google Planet Explorer ISOs you'll find websites devoted to models that you can download and play with.  There are turrets and lots of guns, it's amazing what people have done with this.

Grav has been fun so far, it's a different game.. and Planet Explorers is amazing and fun too.

TL;DR: Planet Explorers is amazing because you can create a lot of custom content very easily using many parts and resources.  The story mode is very indepth.

at the moment I don't recommend it because.

:19 of the twenty hours I put into this game only just let me understand most of the basics.
:Multiplayer doesn't work at all.
:Multiplayer is serverly limited if you do manage.
:Highly frustrating when you have to go back and forth over the 1 hour long map on barefoot.

Early Access Review

Sadly this game is unplayable for me... at this point.  It is Alpha, but has a long way to go for sure.  That being said it has massive potential.

How is it unplayable? The camera angle locks between the playable character's legs and there is no in game cure at the moment.

I did consult the forums and the only known fix at this point is to reinstall the game (didnt work_ and/or unininstall my game pad.  I am unwilling to do this as a fix because it is of detrement to other games, yes I can reinstall, but its too much to ask for someone to do consistantly.

For that reason I do not recommend this game YET... but only on the grounds I believe its in Alpha and tanking money too soon- I have every belife it will be fixed and my review will easily change to recommend in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I bought this game 6 months ago (pre-steam) thinking it would be an amazing upgrade from minecraft. Graphically it is, but when you get down to it. The controls are so bad. I don't know why a traditional WASD control system couldn't be used. It makes combat agains basic monsters so difficult expect to die after any encoutner

The custom design feature is pretty cool with one exception, there in no comprehensible tutorial included in the game. You basically have to know how to use auto-cat programs already or find a youtuber that explains the process well enough.

While Minecraft resource gathering is tideous, but in this game you literally have no way of knowing if you are gathering the right plant until seeing it for the 20th time and i hope you find it again. Wanna dig a giant hole in the ground? COOL! Just make sure you have a way out, because the caves in this game give you no hope for survival.

If you are trying to build a fort to protect from a monster onslaught good luck because those guys can pretty much fly. If a herd wants you dead, your chance of escape is like 20% tops.

Overall this game tries to take a game like Minecraft and add elements of modern gaming, however it lacks in the simplicity that minecraft was able to hand out on a silver platter, and it was done with no instructions.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tired of minecraft, want more? Planet explorer offers a great deal more!
Relative to minecraft, the graphics are infinitely better than minecraft, based on terrain you can do just as much as minecraft, but more realistic and survival like, no punching dirt into youre inventory, you first need a shovel! Placing blocks is different than minecraft, but you don't need it equipped to your tool bar to do so, still able to create castles of stone and diamond, or dirt, whichever is your preference. But wait, that's not all! The ability to create and customize your own weapons and vehicles within the game, and the ability to use and create them in the game, single player, multiplayer, and just plain adventure!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPlanet explorers is the best open world sand box game that I have everr played. The combat is excellent with many different types of weapons to use and a wide variety of animals and aliens to hunt and all of them give some type of resource upon killing them, usually meat or some item that can be sold to vendors for currency. The crafting system is excellent and has many armor pieces that can be crafted out of differnt level resources from wood to diamonds. The crafting system also allows you to design and build custom armor, weapons, and aircraft/vehicles/boats all with their own individual stats based on what material you used and how much of that material is in the design. You can also manage a colony and build many useful buildings in the colony such as replicator, training station, repair facilities and more. You can build a tram in the game world and then ride in that tram. There are many quests to do in the story mode. There is a good farming system once you have a colony set up. There is a lot of things to do in this game. I highly recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have spent alot of time into this game. Offline gameplay over 100 hours. THe reason I am spending so much time offline is because I am a semi truck driver and this game helps pass the time, very quickly. I  spent 10 hours one day building a gigantic base on top of a mountain with several tunnels going to different points where I mined  the area out. Yes mining can get boring, but with how much you can get back for mining it can be quite rewarding. And if you dont like doing anything repeatedly, but want to build,  there is a mode where all you have to do is build, dont have to worry about aliens. So dont have to mine  at all if you dont want to.

But mining can be done is such a way,  that you can have tunnels going through the entire map. My current project Im working on in game is to have connecting roads underground, on ground, and above ground. I'm currently in adventure mode so I have to constantly kill aliens, but get rewarded with a in game road system that allows me to drive anywhere where I want to in game, quickly and safely. (Except for certain gigantic aliens with lasers that kill me so quickly I dont even get the chance to defend myself). And after mining you have 70 plus aliens you can go off and kill. By the time they finish there will be so many aliens to kill that the only way to get more different creature types in a video game is go get a nintendo handheld and play pokemon games.

I must say I was surprised by this game and it has reestablish confidence in a industry that is being bombarded by games that are constantly the same. Even with the game in its current state is a fun game to play. This game has me conflicted between two games, state of decay and this game. I usually play this game but I so want to play that other game myself. I run out of time to play both. I recommend this game to a variety of different play groups.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is very addicting, like world of warcraft addicting, single player story so far is amazing, there's a build mode with no creatures, or you can go online and play with friends.

The designer to design whatever kind of vehicle, gun, sword, or pretty much anything else you can think of is awesome, and the fact you can save and export to iso is great for sharing and receiving new creations.

It has a peaceful feel to it with the music and the scenery, and every hill you go over almost has something new, but it's full of enough suprises to keep you scanning around for threats.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is really amazing, the depth is there but you are not required to get into it.  As fun as any survival game but without the repetitive zombie theme, instead you get a nice change with the sci-fi theme that brings crazy scenery, plants, bugs and even a somewhat scary enemy.  jEven at the early stage of alpha this game is currently in there is so much to do, once you figure out how to do something you will quickly be finding more and more to do and before you know it you have played for 6 hours.  You might think you would have gotten alot done in that time, well not likely the map in this game.....its enormous.  But for good reason, there is a creation system in the game that allows you to create; like actually create" your own vehicles.  You get the basic guts and mechanical stuff
date: then you get to completely design the body
hoursPlayed: gun placement
voteText: how many wheels etc etc.\n\nThe creation doesnt just apply to vehicles and aircrafts but you also get the option to completely create your own sword
helpfulPercent: shield and gun designs.  Now you might think that leads to overpowered stupid looking junk that everyone will be using
votesHelpful: wrong the creation system requires you to gather the materials you build with and it will take some trial and error before you really get what you want.  Its simple yet still very detailed when you want it to be
votesTotal: granted there is a short learning curve but those who would enjoy the game will have no problem with that.\n\nAfter watching some videos I recently came to realize there is a glider backpack and a grappling hook in the game that you can aquire somehow.  So far I have only played the story mode and that has taken quite a bit of time to learn and make a small amount of progress through.  So I have not had the thril of jumping off high mountain tops and gliding around this enormous map
votesFunny: or using the grappling hook to climb insane mountains.  I have only seen video of the aircrafts you can potentially design and I cannot wait to design my own.\n\nThe game is every bit worth the $24.99 price tag and to think its only in the alpha stages.  I cannot wait to see what else they add to this game
commentsCount: I unfortunately do not have the internet access to use the multiplayer feature but exploring this massive world with all the options they give you would be alot of fun with a friend or two.  I look forward to the future of this game and hopefully you will take the time to immerse yourself and enjoy the adventure that is available in Planet Explorers."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For an alpha, this game is surprisingly finished. It shows some serious promise and already is fun as is... well, minus the bugs and the choppy combat systems. The tutorials are a tad confusing, but nothing you can't learn on your own. With more content and maybe a more stable system of controls and combat, this game will be near everything I hoped it would be.

On a side note: the rpg aspect/adventure aspect create a strong MMO feel. . . like it or leave it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love the way planet explorers works, never before have i seen anything as complex and amazing as this games mechanics.
It is entirely possible for you to make your own unique items while on someone's multplayer server and use it or share it with others. Most games would require the host to have a mod enabled on the server for it to be useable but not this game, bring your own items with you! Or even your own veichles.

I love the scanning system even if sometimes it's a little hard to understand, when i scan for certain minerals the scanner doesn't display any results, i don't know if there's just none around me or if i need to upgrade the scanner but meh.

Best thing is this game is in alpha so imagine how much more is to come!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is kinda confusing at the very beginning but all you have to remember is F2 locks and unlocks your cursor and you can harvest alot of the things in the game.  Mining goes below ground with what limit I have yet to try to reach.  The crafting in the game is simple enough and can be done anywhere and you can make multiples at one time in the same time as one which takes alot of the repetativeness of crafting in other games out.  There are a few flaws that I don't like such as the chat popping up when someone talks in a Multiplayer game but if you just move the window out of your way instead of closing it everytime it won't do it anymore.

This review is short for the fact that the game is still in Alpha and I have only played 5 hours so far but this game is definately going in the right track.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI love the opportunity and the diversity of the game. Sure, it has a lot of glitches and bugs but thats what you get for playing an alpha game. Every person that buys this game contributes to making this game a better game. One upsides would be that you have a great deal of freedom in how you tackle the game, especially the crafting/ISO portion gives way for really fun creations. On the down side, it's kinda slow going and a bit daunting sometimes. Plus combat is kinda wonky at times and your weapons don't get real good until much much much later in the game. But overall it's a pretty wonderful and beautiful game that I enjoy playing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A sandbox game made right. THis allows you to design your own vehicles, weapons, and - of course - buildings. It is highly polished for an alpha version, even with voice acting at some points. Bugs are extremelly rare yet the game seeps incompletion with empty spaces where future content is to be placed. Despite large expanses and plenty going on it is not resource intensive so fits into the simplicity of many sandbox games

This is a definate must buy if you are into sandbox or RPG games.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While still in Alpha, the building tools are VERY fun!  Holy crap :)  The story, as of 3/14/2015, is not bad; fun dynamic from a few sci-fi predictions with a Earth and Mars colonial falling out (Babylon 5 comes to mind).  Custom weapons is awesome... but custom vehicles and airships?  Damn!  Custom buildings... custom cities lol!  Fun times, for those of us who love sandbox creativity!

Adventure mode offers a great bit of fun for people who want to sandbox it even harder, away from the story mode limitations.  Of course, being diced to pieces by a massive floating disc of death just a ways away from the starting colony was amusing.

Really looking forward to seeing how the game develops!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Awesome game with loads of potential. If you're thinking about picking this up, this is definitely one of the better early access survival/crafting games out there with decent graphics and art direction as wheel as physics and vehicles. In it's current state I'd say it's worth the money as it offers hours of fun gameplay and exploration in the Story Mode.

Multiplayer and world generation need more work though, it's playable and has potential but the generated worlds are currently no where near as good as the Story map (Maybe the Devs could add an option to use it in multiplayer at some stage?).

It would be nice also, if it had some pre-made iso's to start you off for vehicles and I'm pretty sure it's going to be added later, but still, searching through pages of downloads on external websites to find some basic vehicle designs can be a bit time consuming, but worth it once you find them.

PS: Always test the stuff you download first in build mode before spending your resources in game so you know if there needs to be any personal adjustments made (such as 4-wheeled steering for a much better turning circle).

I've been following this game for more than a year and I helped fund it. I can't wait to see where it goes and it's pretty awesome seeing how far it's come since the playable version they had up for download in Kickstarter. Well done Pathea, keep the updates coming and ideas flowing.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My opinion on the game is at the top, and my personal story with the game is at the bottom.

I think all of the great things about this game are apparent in the trailer, so I will touch on the cons:

-Controls/Camera:

The movement is a little jumpy and floaty (if you jump and hold forward you will 'stick' to the wall). The camera is rough and will often go through walls when you are in tight/interior areas. Your chacter will clip through walls and other geometry, commonly resulting in being deposited on the other side. Especially when using the awesome rope gun to grapple around (like Dying Light).

-Combat:

Combat doesn't have a sense of connection to the attacks and reactions of things being hit. There is no real reason to go melee over ranged unless you want to spend more repairing all your armor.

Despite these things I mentioned, the rest of the system is so fun they didn't really matter to me. When this game is more stable I know I will put a lot of time into this game and enjoy it completely. *** I will repeat, even if all the issues above aren't improved/resolved when the game exits alpha/beta, I would still play and recommend this game (it's that good). ***

I recommend the game, just be aware some parts are rough around the edges and you could lose your hard work at any time. (read below for more info on that)

--- My personal disaster ---

My friends and I had a lot of fun running around, making things, mining, gliding, fighting, etc. After putting about 30 hours into making a colony, and various other things, the game crashed after logging into our server in the area near our colony. It loads fully and crashes after about 3 seconds in game.

My friend logged in to the server fine in another area and was able to come to the colony without issues. When he logged out in this area and then logged back in, same crash. So, something is corrupt in this area of the map. No we both cannot log in. 30 hours seemingly lost, though it was fun getting there. As this game is in alpha we knew the risk. That being said, we aren't playing until it gets a full release or some massive updates.
